plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: The Christmas Rose is an evergreen perennial known for its early blooming, often flowering in late winter. It showcases white to pale pink cup-shaped flowers that brighten shaded garden corners during the colder months.
plants.location: Europe, especially mountainous regions in Central Europe
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose often blooms after Christmas, sometimes even into late winter or early spring.

plants.name: Prunus persica
plants.description: Peach trees produce delicate pink flowers that bloom before the leaves fully emerge, signaling the coming of spring. These blossoms are not only ornamental but also essential for fruit development.
plants.location: Temperate regions including China, Mediterranean, and parts of the United States
plants.funFact: Peach blossoms have been symbols of longevity and romance in Chinese culture for centuries.

plants.funFact: Silver Wattle flowers are used in the perfume industry for their sweet, floral scent.

plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: These early spring bulbs bloom in late winter to early spring with goblet-shaped flowers in various colors like purple, yellow, and white. They often emerge through snow, making them a symbol of seasonal change.
plants.funFact: Crocus vernus is one of the first flowers to bloom and can often be seen pushing through snow, heralding the end of winter.
